responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Missing access control for all statuses column options
    analysis: |
      The AllStatusesColumn class allows specifying options like the number of builds to show and how to format the time display. However, there are no restrictions on who can configure these options when adding this column to a view. 
      
      This could allow low-privileged users to display an excessive number of builds or select a time format that impacts server performance. While not directly exploitable, it highlights a lack of access control for the configuration options on this column.
    cwe: CWE-269
    function_names:
      - AllStatusesColumn
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/robestone/hudson/compactcolumns/AllStatusesColumn.java
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Unsafe reflection to access potentially sensitive Color class field
    analysis: |
      The BuildInfo class contains a method getStableColor() which uses reflection to access the private "value" field of the java.awt.Color class. This field contains the RGB value of the Color object.

      Accessing private fields via reflection circumvents encapsulation and could expose internal representation. In this case, the "value" field is not sensitive, but using reflection to access fields on core Java classes sets a dangerous precedent that could lead to exposure of sensitive data in other contexts.
      
      Additionally, the reflective access is not guarded by any security manager checks, so it would succeed even under a restrictive security policy. However, exploitation is limited since only a Color field is being accessed here.
    cwe: CWE-470
    function_names:
      - BuildInfo.getStableColor
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/robestone/hudson/compactcolumns/BuildInfo.java  
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Unvalidated number of builds may impact performance
    analysis: |
      The hideDays parameter in the AllStatusesColumn class controls how many days of builds to display. This value comes from user input and is not validated to be within reasonable limits. 
      
      An extremely large hideDays value would cause a large number of builds to be processed and displayed. While not a security vulnerability, this could impact Jenkins performance and UI usability.

      To prevent unreasonably large hideDays values, some basic validation should be added, such as capping it at a maximum allowed limit.
    cwe: CWE-400
    function_names:
      - AllStatusesColumn
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/robestone/hudson/compactcolumns/AllStatusesColumn.java
    classification: not promising
```

leads.headline: Missing access control for all statuses column options
leads.analysis:
The AllStatusesColumn class allows specifying options like the number of builds to show and how to format the time display. However, there are no restrictions on who can configure these options when adding this column to a view. 

This could allow low-privileged users to display an excessive number of builds or select a time format that impacts server performance. While not directly exploitable, it highlights a lack of access control for the configuration options on this column.

leads.headline: Unsafe reflection to access potentially sensitive Color class field
leads.analysis:
The BuildInfo class contains a method getStableColor() which uses reflection to access the private "value" field of the java.awt.Color class. This field contains the RGB value of the Color object.

Accessing private fields via reflection circumvents encapsulation and could expose internal representation. In this case, the "value" field is not sensitive, but using reflection to access fields on core Java classes sets a dangerous precedent that could lead to exposure of sensitive data in other contexts.

Additionally, the reflective access is not guarded by any security manager checks, so it would succeed even under a restrictive security policy. However, exploitation is limited since only a Color field is being accessed here.

leads.headline: Unvalidated number of builds may impact performance
leads.analysis:
The hideDays parameter in the AllStatusesColumn class controls how many days of builds to display. This value comes from user input and is not validated to be within reasonable limits. 

An extremely large hideDays value would cause a large number of builds to be processed and displayed. While not a security vulnerability, this could impact Jenkins performance and UI usability.

To prevent unreasonably large hideDays values, some basic validation should be added, such as capping it at a maximum allowed limit.
